pullRequest.title: Fix the implementation of the nn sum extended FEEL function for edge cases
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixed cases are:

nn sum( [] ) => returned null, now returns 0
nn sum( [null] ) => exception thrown, now returns 0
nn sum( [null, null] ) => returned null, now returns 0

The BaseFEELFunction.java fix could also fix other cases where a list containing a single null element was used in a list.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,6 +35,9 @@
                 { "now()", ZonedDateTime.class , null},
                 { "today()", LocalDate.class, null },
                 { "nn sum( 10, null, 20, 40, null )", new BigDecimal("70", MathContext.DECIMAL128), null },
+                { "nn sum( [] )", new BigDecimal("0", MathContext.DECIMAL128), null },
+                { "nn sum( [ null ] )", new BigDecimal("0", MathContext.DECIMAL128), null },
+                { "nn sum( [ null, null ] )", new BigDecimal("0", MathContext.DECIMAL128), null },

commit.message: Fixed an exception that was thrown when trying to evaluate the FEEL function nn sum( [null] )

beforeCommit.message: Fix the implementation of the nn sum extended FEEL function for edge parameters (all nulls parameter, single null parameter, empty parameter).

afterCommit.message: Fixed an exception that was thrown when trying to evaluate the FEEL function nn sum( [null] )

nodes.bodyText: Consistent with sum([]) = null from DMN spec (v1.3) Table 75, good for me thanks!
